definition: to withdraw/to pull back/to contract/to shrink/to reduce/abbreviation/also pr. [su4]

sentences.english: Thus attacked, the Japanese would be afraid to split up.
sentences.chinese: 一遭到这样的伏击，日军就龟缩作一因。

sentences.english: While you still have the option to wall yourself in and turtle, it is much less effective.
sentences.chinese: 当你依然使用龟缩战术的话，效率会很低下。

sentences.english: Do not you finally prefer that the turtle shrunk?
If you're cowardly again, I'll marry your grandpa.
sentences.chinese: 你要是再龟缩的话，我就要嫁给你爷爷了。

sentences.english: If he waffles and folds, China will win again.
sentences.chinese: 如果他继续龟缩不前的话，中国则又将取胜。

sentences.english: The enemy was holed up in a few isolated strongholds.
sentences.chinese: 敌人龟缩在几个孤立的据点里。

definition: to stand a siege/trapped in a besieged city
to retreat and defend/to withdraw and maintain one's guard
to defend one's property to the death/to cling obstinately to old habits/die-hard
to guard/to hold a fortified position/entrenched
to conceal oneself/to go into hiding/to take cover
to strongly defend one's position/to be entrenched/to cling to
the whole nest came out (idiom); to turn out in full strength
secure as a city protected by a wall of metal and a moat of boiling water (idiom)/well fortified/invulnerable to attack
(of troops stationed in a strategic area) to defend/(fig.) to stand guard/to protect
lit. like a turtle in a jar/to be trapped (idiom)
to fortify defenses and raze the fields (idiom); to leave nothing for the invader/scorched earth policy
